methods.label: fromJson
methods.comment: Overridden function. The fromJson method is called from AbstractJsonConverter&apos;s deserialize method.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is an abbreviated version of code in AbstractJsonConverter.deserialize. It calls the derived class&apos;s fromJson function and passes the result to AbstractJsonConverter.deserializeToProperty
%END REM
Sub deserialize(holder as JsonConversionHolder, source as JsonObject)
   Call deserializeToProperty(holder, fromJson(source), source.label)
End Sub

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment: Overridden function. The toJson method is called from AbstractJsonConverter&apos;s serialize method.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is an abbreviated version of code in AbstractJsonConverter.serialize. It extracts a property value, passes it to the derived class&apos;s toJson function and passes the result to AbstractJsonConverter.serializeToProperty
%END REM
Sub serialize(source as Variant, target as JsonObject)
    Dim propName as String
    Dim execString as String
    propName = Me.labelName
    Set samsaraObj = source
    execString = |If (isObject(samsaraObj.| &amp; propName &amp; |)) Then
        Set samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| &amp; propName &amp; |
    Else
        samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| &amp; propName &amp; |
    End If|
    Call serializeToProperty(toJson(samsaraVal), target)
End Sub

methods.label: withHelper
methods.comment: Passes a JsonConversionHelper with which to convert the object
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is abbreviated code from ComplexPersonTest. It creates a JsonConversionHelper to convert &quot;name&quot; and &quot;type&quot; properties as scalars and passes it to a JsonBasicObjectArrayConverter. Unlike the JsonBasicObjectConverter example, this converts a Variant array of pets.
The population of the Person object is omitted here, but it is generated from the following JSON
{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;Paul&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Withers&quot;,&quot;pets&quot;: [{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Peter&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;Guinea Pig&quot;},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Benjamin&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;Guinea Pig&quot;}]}
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim petConverter as New JsonBasicObjectConverter(&quot;Pet&quot;, &quot;ComplexPersonTest&quot;)
Dim person as Person
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject
Dim petHelper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;name&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;type&quot;)
Call petConverter.withHelper(petHelper.withScalarConverter(&quot;name&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;type&quot;))
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;pets&quot;, petConverter)
Set jsonObj = helper.toJson(person)
methods.signature: Public Function withHelper(helper As JsonConversionHelper) As JsonBasicObjectArrayConverter

Unlike the JsonBasicObjectConverter example, this converts a Variant array of pets.<br />The population of the Person object is omitted here, but it is generated from the following JSON<br />{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;Paul&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Withers&quot;,&quot;pets&quot;: [{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Peter&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;Guinea Pig&quot;},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Benjamin&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;Guinea Pig&quot;}]}<br />%END REM<br />Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()<br />Dim petConverter as New JsonBasicObjectConverter(&quot;Pet&quot;, &quot;ComplexPersonTest&quot;)<br />Dim person as Person<br />Dim jsonObj as JsonObject<br />Dim petHelper as New JsonConversionHelper()<br />Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;name&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;type&quot;)<br />Call petConverter.withHelper(petHelper.withScalarConverter(&quot;name&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;type&quot;))<br />Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;pets&quot;, petConverter)<br />Set jsonObj = helper.toJson(person)
